diff --git a/src/java/org/jivesoftware/openfire/auth/JDBCAuthProvider.java b/src/java/org/jivesoftware/openfire/auth/JDBCAuthProvider.java index 9b52d39f4..9c08454de 100644 --- a/src/java/org/jivesoftware/openfire/auth/JDBCAuthProvider.java +++ b/src/java/org/jivesoftware/openfire/auth/JDBCAuthProvider.java @@ -73,9 +73,9 @@ import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory; * situations where legacy (ex/md5) password hashes were stored and then "upgraded" to a stronger hash algorithm. * Hashes are executed left to right.

*

Example Setting: "md5,sha1"
- * Usage: password ->
- * (md5) 286755fad04869ca523320acce0dc6a4 ->
- * (sha1) 0524b1fc84d315b08db890413e65260040b08caa ->

+ * Usage: password ->
+ * (md5) 286755fad04869ca523320acce0dc6a4 ->
+ * (sha1) 0524b1fc84d315b08db890413e65260040b08caa ->

* *

Bcrypt is supported as a passwordType; however, when chaining password types it MUST be the last type given. (bcrypt hashes are different * every time they are generated)
